title: The Next Step to Self-Sovereign Identity
body:
## The Problem

The current model of the internet does not empower the individual. Organizations solicit personal data for access to their services and platforms. These barriers to entry can lead to exclusivity and discrimination. A user must create an account that provides at least a name and email, and often age, date of birth, race and ethnicity for every online act. This data is shared with third parties, subjecting the user to a harassment of unsolicited emails, ads, and messages. Once the information is in an entity's hands there is no telling what other uses it is exploited for.

![Data Breach!](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xQCN_s1oetGGdyoj6JhVd.jpeg?height=535&width=1024)

This process is repeated again and again for social media, retail, entertainment, event, financial, and professional accounts. The fracturing of our identity into countless pieces creates new vulnerabilities every time we engage with a service. The burden is on the user to manage access to all of these accounts for the privilege of private companies profiting from their data. This is an inefficient, broken system, without mentioning the challenges that arise if a password is forgotten.

Similarly, for every purchase made online the user has to enter their bank card or account information. This is a cumbersome and insecure process, creating new vulnerabilities when this data is transmitted or saved on a platforms centralized system. Blockchain technology solves the payment problem, requiring a user to simply sign a message to complete a transaction. However, payments are only one use case. Blockchain can also solve the broken identity management system, simply requiring message signing to access a new platform. The protocol that will make this possible is what we are building at Mu Methods.

## The Solution

![Singular Digital Identity](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vg15xER5gUOTCUKdAPv9Q.jpeg?height=311&width=700)

No longer will a user need to give up personal information, creating a new account every time they want to access a service or join a community. When they access a new system it will only require a message to be signed in their wallet. Platforms will be connecting to their singular digital identity.

### Identity Protocol

To accomplish this we have to fix the existing cryptographic identity system, then integrate it with payments and off-chain platforms. At Mu Methods we are laser-focused on step one: to provide a foundational identity infrastructure. Similar to the IPFS and blockchain solutions for p2p data transfer and asset management, our protocol is an open-source off-chain solution for public/private key management that can be utilized by any cryptographic identity provider. This network will address three primary issues: account linking, seed phrase recoverability, and decentralized application connectivity.

### Account Linking

Currently connecting crypto accounts requires a user to import/export their seed phrase making it vulnerable to attack. If the seed phrase is unknown, they have to export it from their wallet. It may be stored incorrectly during this process, making it insecure. In addition, it adds a layer of complexity to the user experience. A user may create a new account every time they use a different wallet because they don't feel comfortable importing/exporting their seed phrase. Instead of importing/exporting our network will generate private linking keys to permission new accounts from a primary account, eliminating the need to access the seed phrase over and over again. Mu will generate permissioning private keys through state of the art signature schemes.

### Seed Phrase Recoverability

While this minimizes the need to access the seed phrase, it does not eliminate it. The current single failure point of recoverability is unsustainable and unscalable. If a user loses access to their account when they misplace their seed phrase they are unlikely to utilize it as a safe and secure method of identity and asset management. To solve recoverability for those instances in which a user has lost complete access to their account we will use key sharding. Instead of holding the entire seed phrase in one location it will be split and distributed among several nodes in the network. It is social recovery without the need of smart contracts or friends to distribute the shards to. If the user does not have trusted friends they will be provided with alternative locations for shard distribution. They will not be required to store their seed phrase.

### Decentralized Application Connectivity

In order to transition to the single-tap connectivity necessary to access platforms with our digital ID's, wallet connect standards need an update. Currently a user needs to choose which wallet they are connecting from to communicate with a dapp. Our network will remove this step, no longer requiring the user to choose their wallet. When a dapp proposes to sign a transaction it will go through our network to be signed by any device key. Rather than requesting the local account, the dapp is told what account is going to sign for which transaction. All keys will act from one device/account.

### Verified Credentials

Once these features are functioning the personal identification details required to engage with certain platforms ie. name, age, address, email, social security number, etc. can be securely stored with the network. These proven personal identifiers are referred to as verified credentials. They are private and only accessible if a user permissions them to be. For example, when a bank requires verified identifiers to engage with a client the user can one-tap permission access to the specific and limited information requested.

### Financial Transactions

While crypto payments are functional, they are not scalable. We are closely following legislation in the US and abroad regarding Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC) and stable-coins. Once crypto is legally defined traditional platforms' compliance departments will have a clear path to accepting crypto payments. Integrating these into the digital identities built on our network will eliminate the attack vectors created when financial account information is exposed.

## Transition

We will begin onboarding to the network through pull requests and wallet reviews of the largest wallet providers by Unique Active Wallets. Additionally we will build a proof of concept wallet to demonstrate the networks functionality and security best practices. These strategies will upgrade existing wallet infrastructure as well as set a standard for new wallet providers.

Our vision will take several years to realize and require collaboration with companies across the Web3 ecosystem working on verified credentials, payment systems, and KYC integration. It is going to take many solutions to build this reality. If there are potential synergies between your product and ours, DMâ€™s are open! We are eager to work together and build the future of self-sovereign identity.

title: The Next Step to Self-Sovereign Identity
body:
## The Problem

The current model of the internet does not empower the individual. Organizations solicit personal data for access to their services and platforms. These barriers to entry can lead to exclusivity and discrimination. A user must create an account that provides at least a name and email, and often age, date of birth, race and ethnicity for every online act. This data is shared with third parties, subjecting the user to a harassment of unsolicited emails, ads, and messages. Once the information is in an entity's hands there is no telling what other uses it is exploited for.

![Data Breach!](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xQCN_s1oetGGdyoj6JhVd.jpeg?height=535&width=1024)

This process is repeated again and again for social media, retail, entertainment, event, financial, and professional accounts. The fracturing of our identity into countless pieces creates new vulnerabilities every time we engage with a service. The burden is on the user to manage access to all of these accounts for the privilege of private companies profiting from their data. This is an inefficient, broken system, without mentioning the challenges that arise if a password is forgotten.

Similarly, for every purchase made online the user has to enter their bank card or account information. This is a cumbersome and insecure process, creating new vulnerabilities when this data is transmitted or saved on a platforms centralized system. Blockchain technology solves the payment problem, requiring a user to simply sign a message to complete a transaction. However, payments are only one use case. Blockchain can also solve the broken identity management system, simply requiring message signing to access a new platform. The protocol that will make this possible is what we are building at Mu Methods.

## The Solution

![Singular Digital Identity](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vg15xER5gUOTCUKdAPv9Q.jpeg?height=311&width=700)

No longer will a user need to give up personal information, creating a new account every time they want to access a service or join a community. When they access a new system it will only require a message to be signed in their wallet. Platforms will be connecting to their singular digital identity.

### Identity Protocol

To accomplish this we have to fix the existing cryptographic identity system, then integrate it with payments and off-chain platforms. At Mu Methods we are laser-focused on step one: to provide a foundational identity infrastructure. Similar to the IPFS and blockchain solutions for p2p data transfer and asset management, our protocol is an open-source off-chain solution for public/private key management that can be utilized by any cryptographic identity provider. This network will address three primary issues: account linking, seed phrase recoverability, and decentralized application connectivity.

### Account Linking

Currently connecting crypto accounts requires a user to import/export their seed phrase making it vulnerable to attack. If the seed phrase is unknown, they have to export it from their wallet. It may be stored incorrectly during this process, making it insecure. In addition, it adds a layer of complexity to the user experience. A user may create a new account every time they use a different wallet because they don't feel comfortable importing/exporting their seed phrase. Instead of importing/exporting our network will generate private linking keys to permission new accounts from a primary account, eliminating the need to access the seed phrase over and over again. Mu will generate permissioning private keys through state of the art signature schemes.

### Seed Phrase Recoverability

While this minimizes the need to access the seed phrase, it does not eliminate it. The current single failure point of recoverability is unsustainable and unscalable. If a user loses access to their account when they misplace their seed phrase they are unlikely to utilize it as a safe and secure method of identity and asset management. To solve recoverability for those instances in which a user has lost complete access to their account we will use key sharding. Instead of holding the entire seed phrase in one location it will be split and distributed among several nodes in the network. It is social recovery without the need of smart contracts or friends to distribute the shards to. If the user does not have trusted friends they will be provided with alternative locations for shard distribution. They will not be required to store their seed phrase.

### Decentralized Application Connectivity

In order to transition to the single-tap connectivity necessary to access platforms with our digital ID's, wallet connect standards need an update. Currently a user needs to choose which wallet they are connecting from to communicate with a dapp. Our network will remove this step, no longer requiring the user to choose their wallet. When a dapp proposes to sign a transaction it will go through our network to be signed by any device key. Rather than requesting the local account, the dapp is told what account is going to sign for which transaction. All keys will act from one device/account.

### Verified Credentials

Once these features are functioning the personal identification details required to engage with certain platforms ie. name, age, address, email, social security number, etc. can be securely stored with the network. These proven personal identifiers are referred to as verified credentials. They are private and only accessible if a user permissions them to be. For example, when a bank requires verified identifiers to engage with a client the user can one-tap permission access to the specific and limited information requested.

### Financial Transactions

While crypto payments are functional, they are not scalable. We are closely following legislation in the US and abroad regarding Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC) and stable-coins. Once crypto is legally defined traditional platforms' compliance departments will have a clear path to accepting crypto payments. Integrating these into the digital identities built on our network will eliminate the attack vectors created when financial account information is exposed.

## Transition

We will begin onboarding to the network through pull requests and wallet reviews of the largest wallet providers by Unique Active Wallets. Additionally we will build a proof of concept wallet to demonstrate the networks functionality and security best practices. These strategies will upgrade existing wallet infrastructure as well as set a standard for new wallet providers.

Our vision will take several years to realize and require collaboration with companies across the Web3 ecosystem working on verified credentials, payment systems, and KYC integration. It is going to take many solutions to build this reality. If there are potential synergies between your product and ours, DMâ€™s are open! We are eager to work together and build the future of self-sovereign identity.

title: The Next Step to Self-Sovereign Identity
body:
## The Problem

The current model of the internet does not empower the individual. Organizations solicit personal data for access to their services and platforms. These barriers to entry can lead to exclusivity and discrimination. A user must create an account that provides at least a name and email, and often age, date of birth, race and ethnicity for every online act. This data is shared with third parties, subjecting the user to a harassment of unsolicited emails, ads, and messages. Once the information is in an entity's hands there is no telling what other uses it is exploited for.

![Data Breach!](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xQCN_s1oetGGdyoj6JhVd.jpeg?height=535&width=1024)

This process is repeated again and again for social media, retail, entertainment, event, financial, and professional accounts. The fracturing of our identity into countless pieces creates new vulnerabilities every time we engage with a service. The burden is on the user to manage access to all of these accounts for the privilege of private companies profiting from their data. This is an inefficient, broken system, without mentioning the challenges that arise if a password is forgotten.

Similarly, for every purchase made online the user has to enter their bank card or account information. This is a cumbersome and insecure process, creating new vulnerabilities when this data is transmitted or saved on a platforms centralized system. Blockchain technology solves the payment problem, requiring a user to simply sign a message to complete a transaction. However, payments are only one use case. Blockchain can also solve the broken identity management system, simply requiring message signing to access a new platform. The protocol that will make this possible is what we are building at Mu Methods.

## The Solution

![Singular Digital Identity](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vg15xER5gUOTCUKdAPv9Q.jpeg?height=311&width=700)

No longer will a user need to give up personal information, creating a new account every time they want to access a service or join a community. When they access a new system it will only require a message to be signed in their wallet. Platforms will be connecting to their singular digital identity.

### Identity Protocol

To accomplish this we have to fix the existing cryptographic identity system, then integrate it with payments and off-chain platforms. At Mu Methods we are laser-focused on step one: to provide a foundational identity infrastructure. Similar to the IPFS and blockchain solutions for p2p data transfer and asset management, our protocol is an open-source off-chain solution for public/private key management that can be utilized by any cryptographic identity provider. This network will address three primary issues: account linking, seed phrase recoverability, and decentralized application connectivity.

### Account Linking

Currently connecting crypto accounts requires a user to import/export their seed phrase making it vulnerable to attack. If the seed phrase is unknown, they have to export it from their wallet. It may be stored incorrectly during this process, making it insecure. In addition, it adds a layer of complexity to the user experience. A user may create a new account every time they use a different wallet because they don't feel comfortable importing/exporting their seed phrase. Instead of importing/exporting our network will generate private linking keys to permission new accounts from a primary account, eliminating the need to access the seed phrase over and over again. Mu will generate permissioning private keys through state of the art signature schemes.

### Seed Phrase Recoverability

While this minimizes the need to access the seed phrase, it does not eliminate it. The current single failure point of recoverability is unsustainable and unscalable. If a user loses access to their account when they misplace their seed phrase they are unlikely to utilize it as a safe and secure method of identity and asset management. To solve recoverability for those instances in which a user has lost complete access to their account we will use key sharding. Instead of holding the entire seed phrase in one location it will be split and distributed among several nodes in the network. It is social recovery without the need of smart contracts or friends to distribute the shards to. If the user does not have trusted friends they will be provided with alternative locations for shard distribution. They will not be required to store their seed phrase.

### Decentralized Application Connectivity

In order to transition to the single-tap connectivity necessary to access platforms with our digital ID's, wallet connect standards need an update. Currently a user needs to choose which wallet they are connecting from to communicate with a dapp. Our network will remove this step, no longer requiring the user to choose their wallet. When a dapp proposes to sign a transaction it will go through our network to be signed by any device key. Rather than requesting the local account, the dapp is told what account is going to sign for which transaction. All keys will act from one device/account.

### Verified Credentials

Once these features are functioning the personal identification details required to engage with certain platforms ie. name, age, address, email, social security number, etc. can be securely stored with the network. These proven personal identifiers are referred to as verified credentials. They are private and only accessible if a user permissions them to be. For example, when a bank requires verified identifiers to engage with a client the user can one-tap permission access to the specific and limited information requested.

### Financial Transactions

While crypto payments are functional, they are not scalable. We are closely following legislation in the US and abroad regarding Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC) and stable-coins. Once crypto is legally defined traditional platforms' compliance departments will have a clear path to accepting crypto payments. Integrating these into the digital identities built on our network will eliminate the attack vectors created when financial account information is exposed.

## Transition

We will begin onboarding to the network through pull requests and wallet reviews of the largest wallet providers by Unique Active Wallets. Additionally we will build a proof of concept wallet to demonstrate the networks functionality and security best practices. These strategies will upgrade existing wallet infrastructure as well as set a standard for new wallet providers.

Our vision will take several years to realize and require collaboration with companies across the Web3 ecosystem working on verified credentials, payment systems, and KYC integration. It is going to take many solutions to build this reality. If there are potential synergies between your product and ours, DMâ€™s are open! We are eager to work together and build the future of self-sovereign identity.

title: Jansen journal 11-17 juli
body:
## Maandag 11 juli

* Beetje grumpy wakker: â€œwie pakt Morris om 06:45?â€ Kwamen er met zijn tweetjes snel bovenop. Meneer hoeft alleen zijn brood niet meer, gisteravond ook al moeilijk met het eten. Ook slapen had hij weinig zin in, moeten er bij blijven anders gaat hij huilen. Dus 2 uur laten huilen, met om en om 15 minuten even kort kijken. Dat wordt weer even dagelijks opbouwen voor zowel eten als slapen.  
 Update einde van de week: het slapen gaat steeds beter de goede kant op, we starten met voorlezen in deze hitte (en Morris bleek ziek te zijn deze week) en daarna doen we gewoon weglopen en om de 15 minuten kort kijken. Eten is allemaal goed gekomen, hij eet weer lekker mee. Wilt wel graag zelf eten, echt wel al een klein willetje 
* Contact gehad met de airdrop mensen en website issues verholpen rondom de mint. Titan aantal einde van de week staat op 53 titans van 35 unieke mensen. We zijn gestart.
* Verder een ontspannen dag, veel kleine dingen opgepakt en gestart met Jansesn Journal op mirror (zie vorige post). 
* Ook toegevoegd: Imovie compilatie met de weekfotoâ€™s (te vinden op de harde schijf atm) 
* Hanneke van Dam geholpen aan het einde van de dag met het minten van haar NFT en even lekker bijgepraat. Deze tech is echt nog lang niet klaar voor het grote publiek, ze liep op diverse onderdelen nog vast omdat het compleet nieuw is. Gelachen, kreeg veel energie van het gesprek. Idee: instapcursus/instaples voor complete beginners in het Nederlands op YouTube plaatsen. Samen met Saar en Joep de stappen doorlopen en uitleggen hoe alles werkt, dit opnemen en op YT zetten. 
* Eerste reacties op de NFTs zijn positief. 
* Ronde met Rowin gelpoen: inkopen positie op OtherSide NFT? Laten lopen uiteindelijk, gevoelsmatig ech tveel te overbetaald en overhyped. 
* DAO Funds overgemaakt naar de multisig. 5K. Ook op dit onderdeel zijn we voor het eggie gestart. Ik kan het gevoel maar niet afschudden dat alles wat we hier doen het begin is van een legendarisch traject. 
* Juna & Jack op date, samen eten in de speeltuin haha :-D 
* Idee: windvanger in de tuin hangen met van die chimes. Uiteindelijk zijn het schelpen aan een hanger geworden, ook mooi! 
* Gelachen met de KPN glasvezelkabelmannen. Was een jonkie mee die zijn eerste dag had (met zijn buurman), binnen gelaten en de mannen wat limo gegeven. Komt er eindelijk dan glasvezel aan (afspraak wordt later gemaakt)
* Imovie dus gemaakt, uiteindelijk gekozen voor de auto compilatie ivm tijd. 
* MI2 gekeken, wederom leuk! 
* Energie los laten gooien (Saar drukt met elleboog op beide binnenbenen en werkt vanuit knie omhoog naar lies via binnenkant dij in groef). Veel losgekomen, voelde goed, negatieve energie en ijzeren grip in mijn hoofd kwam los. Erg veel gedroomd, dus misschien beter om in de ochtend te doen 

## Dinsdag 12 juli

* 6 minuten plan. Hardop schreeuwen, ondersteund met muziek om stem in mijn hoofd te overschreeuwen en af te leiden. Zo zie je dat je de grens behoorlijk kan verleggen als je die klotestem soms uitzet. Niet altijd blij met de stem in mijn hoofd dus blijkbaar.
* Minder keelpijn. Update: achteraf bleek dat het nog een flinke zit werd deze week, nog steeds wel last en vermoeid alleen lijkt het nu wel de goede kant op te gaan. 
* Meiden alles zelfstandig voorbereid voor het strand (ingesmeerd, badpakjes aan, saar was al naar werk haha) 
* Instaples opgezet zoals besproken op ma 11 juli: Jor & Saar - crypto dummies. Leuk om neer te zetten. 
  * Superfood report binnen geharkt. Samenvattend:  
 My superfoods: bruine rijst, kersen, cocoa 70%, dille, vijgen, lam, nectarine, oats, haver, olijven, oregano, papaya, persimmon, dadelpruim, pomegranate, raspberry, wilde zalm, sauerkraut, sweet papato or yam, watermelon, white mushroom 
 Ontwijken: artichoke, aspergus, beef, bell pepper (paprika), brocolli, brussels sprouts, cabbage, caviar or roe, cod (kabeljauw), crayfish (rivierkreeft), eigeel, goat, haddock (schelvis), lobster, mustard greens, scallops, pepino melon, shrimp, tomaat, turmeric, turnip, venison or elk (eland). 
* Meiden naar het strand gegaan, papa na lange twijfel toch thuis gebleven. 

## Woensdag 13 juli

* 15 jaar verkering :-) Morris opgepakt op wederom onmogelijke tijd, met de meiden ontbijt op bed gemaakt, klusjes gedaan en gelijk vol gas gegaan ipv rustig aan gedaan en mijn rust gepakt. Ook icm de kijkles etc. De prijs later op de dag dubbel en dwars betaald: charijnig doordat ik zo moe was (vermodelijk ook door virus). 
* In de ochtend was het wel een waar circus en ontbijt op bed in 1. 
* Kijkzwemles was ook erg leuk: wat deden ze het goed! Papa gaat ook les nemen van Heidi, goed instapmoment wel nog te kiezen (even over de drempel heen). Gefietst naar Voorhout, heerijk. 
* Geluksmoment: thee valt weer om, ditmaal over het bureau, maar niets werd geraakt wat schade opleverde. Alles viel naast mij en naast de spullen, mogelijk wel het bibliotheekboek vies uds even berichten bij de bieb. Update: schoon gemaakt, karma test doorstaan :-) 
* Biertje in de Veen was gezellig, even met Rowin bijgepraat. Echter de rit naartoe was niet leuk, veel te chagrijnig en moe. Had het even niet meer. 
* In de avond eten voorschoten ging het wel weer een beetje, maar nog steeds erg moe en zeker niet happy. Wachten op eten duurde lang en uit eten met Moor is gewoon pittig omdat je veel te veel met hem bezig moet zijn (vliegt alle kanten op haha)
* Koios busines model uitgewerkt met focus op de bal, zie 14 juli uitwerking
* Juna geen onderbroek mee op de terugweg, arme meid haha
* Morris mama goed geholpen met het meebezemen en schoonmaken van de tuin! 
* MI3, ijs, heerlijk geslapen! 
* 15 mooie rode rozen voor mijn geweldige vrouw gehaald, was is het toch echt een prachtig wezen op elke manier hoe een mens kan zijn. Mooie kanten, minder mooie kanten. Ze is.
* 

## Donderdag 14 Juli 

* Goed geslapen, enkel het dunne hoeslaken en vermoeidheid (flink!) deden denk de truc. 
* Veel in mijn hoofdmet allerlei plannen. Ik onderneem nu geen radicale grote stappen, enkel kleintjes. Met hyperfocus. Mogelijk vermoeid en nu wat energie komt duiken we gelijk weer de diepte in. HOLD!!
* Met Moor gedouched. Hij vindt het zitten leuk, met ramenwiser, maar wilt niet te dicht met zijn bol bij de straal. En ook niet getild worden. 
* Vandaag komt de kast :-) Update: toch niet, kwam uiteindelijk vrjidag 15 juli, is erg mooi! 
* Met Joepie gaan eten, was nog steeds erg moe om er vol van te genieten, dus gaan we snel even goed over doen. 
* Shiatsu, was de laatste massage omdat Sebastiaan (van Leeuwen) er vandoor gaat. Hoofd voelt als lood, ogen moe, keelpijn. Lijkt wel los te komen, tuk gedaan 
* Heidi voor zwemles gecontact
* Toekomst van speels Koios in een droom gezien: digitaal, pretparkachtig, vogelvlucht kon je alles overzien, in 3D, kon je iets selecteren en dan inzoomen (alsof je van vogelvlucht erin dook, daar zag je dan vervolgens het spel spelen met de anderen deelnemers en kijkers eromheen! Essentieel: iedereen was eigenaar van zijn/haar eigen stukje van de plattegrond. Deel van de kaart was algemeen bezit, maar in het noorden was de speeltuin en daar bezaten mensen eigen bezit. 
* Hele leuke film gezien in cafÃ© Druk mijn Snor: Sea Beast. Inclusief B&Jerry
* Morris eet weer goed. Wel speen overdag en die gaan we dus wegdoen vanaf nu. Update: Dit lijkt lekker te lopen. Ook het in slaap vallen met weglopen gaat stuk beter! 
* Flinke ingeving voor Koios verbetervoorstellen. Heeft uiteindelijk geleidt tot een klein document met mini roadmap voor september. Met Titan Trollbox iedereen individueel rondom de tafel zitten en meningen verzamelen. 

Vrijdag 15 en zaterdag 16 juli 

* Vergeten leuke dingen bij te houden! Oeps, merk ook dat het daardoor wat minder â€˜chill / flowerigâ€™ verloopt. RUST pakken Jor :-) 
* De BBq met de fam en kids was geweldig, vooral de avondbioscoop vond ik superleuk voor de kids om te doen (herinneringen maken). Lieke natuurlijk ook uitgenodigd. 
* Naar de markt met de meiden (race gewonnen wie als eerst beneden was!), mooie bloemen op de markt kunnen vinden, fruit was ook erg goed en superfoods ingeslagen uit rapport. 
* 1 op 1 met Fiene in de bios (was wel moe, god was is dat vervelend)
* Patatjes met ijs als avondeten! 
* 10 tellen in de rimboe gedaan met de kids 
* Geverfd! Mooi geworden 
* Tuin opgeknapt en nieuwe dressoir geinstalleerd. Nieuwe TV is next (is besteld op maandag de 18e)

Zondag 17 juli

* heerlijk gewandeld met ma in Amsterdamse waterleidingduinen. Veel gelachen, mooie bosroute, wild gepoept, mensen verteld dat mama in haar broek poept tijdens hardlopen, kwamen Ruby tegen in Jan zijn stamcafÃ© pannenland. 
* BBq met Rolletjes en de Driehoek. Zwembad stond ook buiten! 
* Wakker worden na zwaar nachtje met sterke mama (zingend â€œeen man weet pas wat hij mist, weet pas wat hij mist, als ze er niet is) 
* Verrrven 
* Morris 360graden spin, meedansen met zusjes , boem!

title: The Next Step to Self-Sovereign Identity
body:
## The Problem

The current model of the internet does not empower the individual. Organizations solicit personal data for access to their services and platforms. These barriers to entry can lead to exclusivity and discrimination. A user must create an account that provides at least a name and email, and often age, date of birth, race and ethnicity for every online act. This data is shared with third parties, subjecting the user to a harassment of unsolicited emails, ads, and messages. Once the information is in an entity's hands there is no telling what other uses it is exploited for.

![Data Breach!](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xQCN_s1oetGGdyoj6JhVd.jpeg?height=535&width=1024)

This process is repeated again and again for social media, retail, entertainment, event, financial, and professional accounts. The fracturing of our identity into countless pieces creates new vulnerabilities every time we engage with a service. The burden is on the user to manage access to all of these accounts for the privilege of private companies profiting from their data. This is an inefficient, broken system, without mentioning the challenges that arise if a password is forgotten.

Similarly, for every purchase made online the user has to enter their bank card or account information. This is a cumbersome and insecure process, creating new vulnerabilities when this data is transmitted or saved on a platforms centralized system. Blockchain technology solves the payment problem, requiring a user to simply sign a message to complete a transaction. However, payments are only one use case. Blockchain can also solve the broken identity management system, simply requiring message signing to access a new platform. The protocol that will make this possible is what we are building at Mu Methods.

## The Solution

![Singular Digital Identity](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vg15xER5gUOTCUKdAPv9Q.jpeg?height=311&width=700)

No longer will a user need to give up personal information, creating a new account every time they want to access a service or join a community. When they access a new system it will only require a message to be signed in their wallet. Platforms will be connecting to their singular digital identity.

### Identity Protocol

To accomplish this we have to fix the existing cryptographic identity system, then integrate it with payments and off-chain platforms. At Mu Methods we are laser-focused on step one: to provide a foundational identity infrastructure. Similar to the IPFS and blockchain solutions for p2p data transfer and asset management, our protocol is an open-source off-chain solution for public/private key management that can be utilized by any cryptographic identity provider. This network will address three primary issues: account linking, seed phrase recoverability, and decentralized application connectivity.

### Account Linking

Currently connecting crypto accounts requires a user to import/export their seed phrase making it vulnerable to attack. If the seed phrase is unknown, they have to export it from their wallet. It may be stored incorrectly during this process, making it insecure. In addition, it adds a layer of complexity to the user experience. A user may create a new account every time they use a different wallet because they don't feel comfortable importing/exporting their seed phrase. Instead of importing/exporting our network will generate private linking keys to permission new accounts from a primary account, eliminating the need to access the seed phrase over and over again. Mu will generate permissioning private keys through state of the art signature schemes.

### Seed Phrase Recoverability

While this minimizes the need to access the seed phrase, it does not eliminate it. The current single failure point of recoverability is unsustainable and unscalable. If a user loses access to their account when they misplace their seed phrase they are unlikely to utilize it as a safe and secure method of identity and asset management. To solve recoverability for those instances in which a user has lost complete access to their account we will use key sharding. Instead of holding the entire seed phrase in one location it will be split and distributed among several nodes in the network. It is social recovery without the need of smart contracts or friends to distribute the shards to. If the user does not have trusted friends they will be provided with alternative locations for shard distribution. They will not be required to store their seed phrase.

### Decentralized Application Connectivity

In order to transition to the single-tap connectivity necessary to access platforms with our digital ID's, wallet connect standards need an update. Currently a user needs to choose which wallet they are connecting from to communicate with a dapp. Our network will remove this step, no longer requiring the user to choose their wallet. When a dapp proposes to sign a transaction it will go through our network to be signed by any device key. Rather than requesting the local account, the dapp is told what account is going to sign for which transaction. All keys will act from one device/account.

### Verified Credentials

Once these features are functioning the personal identification details required to engage with certain platforms ie. name, age, address, email, social security number, etc. can be securely stored with the network. These proven personal identifiers are referred to as verified credentials. They are private and only accessible if a user permissions them to be. For example, when a bank requires verified identifiers to engage with a client the user can one-tap permission access to the specific and limited information requested.

### Financial Transactions

While crypto payments are functional, they are not scalable. We are closely following legislation in the US and abroad regarding Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC) and stable-coins. Once crypto is legally defined traditional platforms' compliance departments will have a clear path to accepting crypto payments. Integrating these into the digital identities built on our network will eliminate the attack vectors created when financial account information is exposed.

## Transition

We will begin onboarding to the network through pull requests and wallet reviews of the largest wallet providers by Unique Active Wallets. Additionally we will build a proof of concept wallet to demonstrate the networks functionality and security best practices. These strategies will upgrade existing wallet infrastructure as well as set a standard for new wallet providers.

Our vision will take several years to realize and require collaboration with companies across the Web3 ecosystem working on verified credentials, payment systems, and KYC integration. It is going to take many solutions to build this reality. If there are potential synergies between your product and ours, DMâ€™s are open! We are eager to work together and build the future of self-sovereign identity.

title: The Next Step to Self-Sovereign Identity
body:
## The Problem

The current model of the internet does not empower the individual. Organizations solicit personal data for access to their services and platforms. These barriers to entry can lead to exclusivity and discrimination. A user must create an account that provides at least a name and email, and often age, date of birth, race and ethnicity for every online act. This data is shared with third parties, subjecting the user to a harassment of unsolicited emails, ads, and messages. Once the information is in an entity's hands there is no telling what other uses it is exploited for.

![Data Breach!](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xQCN_s1oetGGdyoj6JhVd.jpeg?height=535&width=1024)

This process is repeated again and again for social media, retail, entertainment, event, financial, and professional accounts. The fracturing of our identity into countless pieces creates new vulnerabilities every time we engage with a service. The burden is on the user to manage access to all of these accounts for the privilege of private companies profiting from their data. This is an inefficient, broken system, without mentioning the challenges that arise if a password is forgotten.

Similarly, for every purchase made online the user has to enter their bank card or account information. This is a cumbersome and insecure process, creating new vulnerabilities when this data is transmitted or saved on a platforms centralized system. Blockchain technology solves the payment problem, requiring a user to simply sign a message to complete a transaction. However, payments are only one use case. Blockchain can also solve the broken identity management system, simply requiring message signing to access a new platform. The protocol that will make this possible is what we are building at Mu Methods.

## The Solution

![Singular Digital Identity](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vg15xER5gUOTCUKdAPv9Q.jpeg?height=311&width=700)

No longer will a user need to give up personal information, creating a new account every time they want to access a service or join a community. When they access a new system it will only require a message to be signed in their wallet. Platforms will be connecting to their singular digital identity.

### Identity Protocol

To accomplish this we have to fix the existing cryptographic identity system, then integrate it with payments and off-chain platforms. At Mu Methods we are laser-focused on step one: to provide a foundational identity infrastructure. Similar to the IPFS and blockchain solutions for p2p data transfer and asset management, our protocol is an open-source off-chain solution for public/private key management that can be utilized by any cryptographic identity provider. This network will address three primary issues: account linking, seed phrase recoverability, and decentralized application connectivity.

### Account Linking

Currently connecting crypto accounts requires a user to import/export their seed phrase making it vulnerable to attack. If the seed phrase is unknown, they have to export it from their wallet. It may be stored incorrectly during this process, making it insecure. In addition, it adds a layer of complexity to the user experience. A user may create a new account every time they use a different wallet because they don't feel comfortable importing/exporting their seed phrase. Instead of importing/exporting our network will generate private linking keys to permission new accounts from a primary account, eliminating the need to access the seed phrase over and over again. Mu will generate permissioning private keys through state of the art signature schemes.

### Seed Phrase Recoverability

While this minimizes the need to access the seed phrase, it does not eliminate it. The current single failure point of recoverability is unsustainable and unscalable. If a user loses access to their account when they misplace their seed phrase they are unlikely to utilize it as a safe and secure method of identity and asset management. To solve recoverability for those instances in which a user has lost complete access to their account we will use key sharding. Instead of holding the entire seed phrase in one location it will be split and distributed among several nodes in the network. It is social recovery without the need of smart contracts or friends to distribute the shards to. If the user does not have trusted friends they will be provided with alternative locations for shard distribution. They will not be required to store their seed phrase.

### Decentralized Application Connectivity

In order to transition to the single-tap connectivity necessary to access platforms with our digital ID's, wallet connect standards need an update. Currently a user needs to choose which wallet they are connecting from to communicate with a dapp. Our network will remove this step, no longer requiring the user to choose their wallet. When a dapp proposes to sign a transaction it will go through our network to be signed by any device key. Rather than requesting the local account, the dapp is told what account is going to sign for which transaction. All keys will act from one device/account.

### Verified Credentials

Once these features are functioning the personal identification details required to engage with certain platforms ie. name, age, address, email, social security number, etc. can be securely stored with the network. These proven personal identifiers are referred to as verified credentials. They are private and only accessible if a user permissions them to be. For example, when a bank requires verified identifiers to engage with a client the user can one-tap permission access to the specific and limited information requested.

### Financial Transactions

While crypto payments are functional, they are not scalable. We are closely following legislation in the US and abroad regarding Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC) and stable-coins. Once crypto is legally defined traditional platforms' compliance departments will have a clear path to accepting crypto payments. Integrating these into the digital identities built on our network will eliminate the attack vectors created when financial account information is exposed.

## Transition

We will begin onboarding to the network through pull requests and wallet reviews of the largest wallet providers by Unique Active Wallets. Additionally we will build a proof of concept wallet to demonstrate the networks functionality and security best practices. These strategies will upgrade existing wallet infrastructure as well as set a standard for new wallet providers.

Our vision will take several years to realize and require collaboration with companies across the Web3 ecosystem working on verified credentials, payment systems, and KYC integration. It is going to take many solutions to build this reality. If there are potential synergies between your product and ours, DMâ€™s are open! We are eager to work together and build the future of self-sovereign identity.

title: Should Cannabis Genome DAO Own A Lab?
body:
## Web3 Is About Aligning Incentives

We think the genomic testing world could use a little more transparency and emphasis on the rights of individuals to control their data. This initiative would make Cannabis Genome DAO the first digital cooperative to maintain an ownership stake in a physical laboratory. As such, Cannabis Genome DAO would be granted full rights of a member of the company with access to financial reporting and an ability to ensure that the fidelity and transparency of laboratory practices are maintained. The alignment of incentives and governance rights between a community that benefits from using the laboratory, with the governance and incentives of the laboratory operations itself, directly benefits the community and users of the laboratories services.

## Overview of Proposed Crowdfund

Funding would go toward purchasing a membership interest in Delta Leaf, which is currently undergoing equity fundraising in pursuit of a traditional VC investment or strategic partnership from another organization. This provides the opportunity for Cannabis Genome DAO to fill that need. Funding from the sale of membership interest in Delta Leaf would be used for improving and expanding their services. These services include an upgrade to the Delta Leaf web app that would enable users to manage their laboratory results using self-custodial web3 wallets with the option to publish directly to the data marketplace being developed by Cannabis Genome DAO. Governance of Delta Leaf would be aligned with the mission and values of Cannabis Genome DAO because members of the latter would exert a significant amount of direct control over the operations of the former.

The crowdfund would be hosted here on Mirror and structured as a sale of a collection of tiered NFT editions. More information below.

* [Cannabis Genome DAO](https://cannabisgeno.me) (â€œCGDâ€) would purchase a 20% membership interest in [Delta Leaf Laboratories LLC](https://deltaleaflabs.com) (â€œDelta Leafâ€), a California Limited Liability Corporation.
* Cannabis Genome DAO (â€œCGD") is a "[nonprofit association](https://ipfs//bafybeifzhrfh47zq743j35hq7v6lwmoqizzj665hwp7zzoqig6abveog6i/?filename=Delaware_UNA_Agreement_-_CGD.pdf)" under the Delaware Uniform Unincorporated Nonprofit Association Act, Del. Code Ann. Tit. 6, Â§Â§ 1901-1916. CGD is not intended to be, and shall not be deemed to be, a partnership.
* Governance of the CGDâ€™s membership interest in Delta Leaf would be managed through the distribution of DLL tokens to members of CGD who contribute to this fundraiser.
* The total DLL token supply would exclusively distribute governance rights to CGD members and does not distribute ownership right in Delta Leaf to individual members of CGD.
* DLL tokens would not, and will not, represent any financial claim by individual CGD members to potential profit or obligation to potential losses incurred by CGD while CGD is acting as a member of Delta Leaf.
* CGD and the CGD treasury would incur all financial profit and loss related to membership of CGD in Delta Leaf. The proceeds of this crowdfund will be sent to the CGD community multi-sig for the explicit purpose of completing the purchase of a membership interest in Delta Leaf as described herein.

![Felipe's cousin Isaac made this graphic years ago.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/D9MgsIfEXNqBfUuhtGwnJ.png?height=1440&width=2560)

## DLL Token Allocations

Governance of Delta Leaf comprises a subset of the proposed activities encompassed by the [CGD Community Hyperthesis](https://docs.google.com/document/d/182fZ2WIQCL15O0TbQmkaJFM8tci06czuuqTMzBl_-zs/edit?usp=sharing). Therefore, the token allocation will primarily be distributed directly to participants in the crowdfunding campaign with only 20% being reserved for community management by CGD itself. This will decentralize governance directly to financial supporters while aligning them with the remaining CGD community who does not participate in the crowdfunding campaign or joins the community later after the campaign ends. Further, an additional 10% will be reserved for incentivizing the ongoing development of infrastructure for the regenerative crypto-economic system proposed in the CGD Community Hyperthesis. This third portion will align the potential success of this crowdfund with the CGD ecosystem in the short term.

* 70% of the DLL token supply will be allocated directly to CGD members who contribute to the fundraiser.
* 20% of the DLL token supply will be reserved in the CGD treasury and managed by a community multi-sig wallet.
  * Multi-sig address: 0xb39EB13E9B69809ed938842D5Ea1A89a97787315
* 10% of the DLL token supply will be sent to a separate multi-sig wallet to be used exclusively for incentivizing the development of CSAT token smart contracts, a custom front-end for CannaData.Market and other initiatives for CGD.
  * Multi-sig address: 0x99A05055820f8c4794879B2617b520513C7DFca1

### CGD Educational Course

Delta Leaf will develop an online and in-person bootcamp course available at a discount for CGD members to teach basic molecular biology lab skills required to perform entry-level technical work in the cannabis industry. The online part of the course will instruct students in fundamental background knowledge through a combination of animations, live whiteboard demos, and slide presentations.

Students will be able to claim a non-transferrable NFT Certificate after completing learning assessments throughout the course and passing a final examination\*. Students holding the NFT Certificate will be eligible to enroll in a paid, small group, live training course held on-site at Delta Leaf Laboratories in Santa Barbara, CA.

*\*Note: a small number of NFT Certificates to enroll in the first cohort of the live training course will be sold as part of the crowdfund.*

title: What DAOs Can Learn from Rainbow â€” 50yrs of Decentralized Autonomous Gathering
body:
## The Immense Potential of DAOs

For an in-depth yet beginner friendly introduction to DAOs, please check out [this NYTimes article](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2022/03/18/technology/what-are-daos.html).

Historically, centralized powerÂ seemed to have obviously â€˜wonâ€™ against the decentralized crowd â€”â€” we have witnessed how local faiths overpowered by organized religions, co-ops outcompeted by conglomerates, indigenous tribes eliminated by empires. We live in a world where profit incentives arenâ€™t aligned with the common wealth and resources are shamefully extracted to maximize profit for individual gains.

Without doubt, technologies are best used to serve humanityâ€™s overall well-being. Blockchain solutions can be used to realign our incentives, create equitable and transparent systems to avoid corruption and exploitation. The DAO space has huge potential to create **community-oriented autonomous templates to fundamentally decentralize the way humans operate** in order to **create abundance for all.**

![Homemade meme about DAOs](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TrgE2iuoFa1Fvi7OIiyOx.png?height=1011&width=1166)

Within a system that is transparent and fair, people would operate better because they â€˜canâ€™t do badâ€™ instead of â€˜wonâ€™t do badâ€™. The Gitcoinâ€™s theory on [ImpactDAOs](https://store.gitcoin.co/products/impactdao-book-digital-edition) did a deep dive into this philosophy.

It is worth noting that DAOs are still in its infancy, most DAOs are in its process of figuring out the best suited ways to govern. Many DAOs have very long and redundant execution processes as a protection against centralized dictatorship which often led to inefficiency and bureaucracy.Â Being born at the heart of the crypto industry, DAOs can be filled with pyramid scams and inflated values.

Because of the immaturity and capital-infested nature of crypto, learnings on the art of gathering and coordination may best come from outside of the DAO space. Humans have been organizing in swift and ingenue ways centuries before blockchain technology appeared.

DAOs are schelling points for strangers to gather around a shared mission & vision and collectively accumulate resources to achieve this shared goal. â€”â€” This is exactly what [Rainbow Gathering](https://rainbowfamilygatherings.net/) has achieved in the past 50 years without blockchain.

## What is the Rainbow Gathering?

![Pic from SDBP Radio](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NHzQChJZjYJaW7Pb2-dou.png?height=542&width=880)

*Special Thanks to [@mycobici](https://twitter.com/mycobici) for encouraging me to go to the 50 years Rainbow Gathering and drawing the analogy between Rainbow and DAOs. Special Thanks to [@imu](https://www.instagram.com/zenthebus/) for sending me courage, love and the Rainbow Gathering coordinate. ğŸ’•*

I heard about the rainbow gathering from an off-grid eco village at the southern tip of Hilo, Hawaii.

â€œItâ€™s a gathering about peace, love and generosity. It is completely free to go and everything was shared in a gift-based societyâ€, said someone from the eco village, who at the time refuses to have a cellphone or wear shoes.

â€œThere is no tickets, no social media. Location changes every year mostly in different national forests and the only way to find out is through word of mouth.

The gatherings also happen all around the world. Europe, the Middle East, Asia, Costa Rica, Mexicoâ€¦ and here on the Big Island! The main gathering is in the US every year, the main international gathering rotates around the world, and there are regionals happening all the time.â€

Rainbow Gathering started in 1972, it is [defined](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rainbow_Gathering) as a gathering where people â€˜congregate in remote forests around the world for one or more weeks at a time with the stated intention of living a shared ideology of peace, harmony, freedom, and respect.â€™

The first gathering happened in Colorado where twenty thousand people faced police roadblocks, threatened [civil disobedience](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_disobedience), and were allowed onto [National Forest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_National_Forest) land. It has spontaneously become a yearly tradition ever since.

In this anti-capitalist and anti-materialist world, people put up temporary cabins and tents, campfires and water filters, shared everything in a mutually respectful way. Regardless of cultural background or race, people shared a common language that is peace and love.

![Pic of Rainbow from Sky-Hi News](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z2Savl-0dyYT_81p5EB0F.png?height=637&width=1024)

It is worth iterating that there are natural problems that come with the gathering, I do not wish to say that everything happens with the Rainbow community is always positive. The concerns about Rainbow Gathering will be claimed in the section in the end.

## How Decentralized?

The gathering has no single leader, no corporation and usually no money involved except for some donations. All organizers gather and find common grounds cooperatively. Anyone that felt the urge to contribute can volunteer to organize since helping hands are always needed.

At each gathering, organizers would arrive weeks in advance to pave roads, study the terrain and plan out the locations. Different kitchen crews would put up camps with cookware, shelves, washing stations, toilet holes and sometimes showers. Individuals usually gather around the kitchens, enjoy the meals and help out when they can.

![Reverse Osmosis Connected to River Water](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/By8WYji7f2M2sDBxgsCII.jpg?height=716&width=1000)

Each camp has its own culture and quite unique characteristics. In the 50yrâ€™s gathering in Colorado, **Instant Soup** served vegan soup 24/7 and always had elderly folks singing around campfire every night. **Wanna Burn** was a kitchen organized by nomad performers and fire spinners and they just felt like lovely pirates. I was told by the crew if anyone took out a cellphone at the kitchen it would get smashed. **Kids Village** as the name suggested were a fun space for kids to run around with small bridges and swings.

![Pic from Atlas Obscura](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kqlMdmqaYgMyuQv4guELZ.png?height=2474&width=3235)

Each kitchen dug its â€˜compostâ€™ holes for organic matters and buried them after theyâ€™re full. â€˜Shittersâ€™ were dug at various locations and ashes and dirt were put on them to avoid flies and diseases. All non-organic trash were carried out by volunteers as people started to leave. Crates from recycle companies were placed at the entrance of the gathering.

At the center you can find **Info Camp** where all info and activities can be found on bulletin boards, medical tents where student volunteers treated the sick and injured.

![Map about the 2022 Gathering in Colorado](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z-ids5g5ZGXDsci0ACZ1q.png?height=1097&width=843)

During the gathering, various events were celebrated and projects were made. On July 4th, everyone gathered in the main lawn and prayed in silence for world peace. People put together sweat lodges, had meetings about permaculture and eco villages. There was yoga and Tai-chi practices, poetry nights, music circles, fire dancingâ€¦ Basically, if enough people want to make something happen, it would happen.

## Unanimous Consensus

![Rainbow Family Pic from Wikipedia](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PWXQIX4NRhW0hSyHjU62x.jpg?height=900&width=1200)

The most important decision every gathering is where to have Rainbow next year. This decision is made by the â€˜Vision Circleâ€™ which is usually held at the end of each gathering. Anyone who shows up at the Vision Circle would may speak and hold voting power regardless of their expertise. Unanimous consensus is required for any decisions to be made, the Vision Circle sometimes take days to complete in order to reach consensus.

I sat at the Vision Circle for hours just to observe the process, it reminds me of filibustering in politics. Although the difference is that anyone who wanted to speak can speak, and there is absolutely no interruption to anyoneâ€™s speech.

Majority of people do not feel the need to participate in this decision making process. Since the location rotates every year across the US, it seems like a natural flow of evenly distributed choices.

I do believe Vision Circle exists more for the spirit of making sure everyoneâ€™s voice is heard. **The nature of unanimous consensus symbolizes that individual satisfaction is less important than group cohesion and harmony, which in itself is a quite beautiful spirit for any organization.** There will always be someone dissatisfied in the end, but everyone still celebrates when a decision was made.

## How Autonomous?

The idea of Rainbow got brought to different corners of the world by people attended the first few gatherings. It has shown that decentralized social movements can be â€˜templatizedâ€™. Once the formula has been play-tested, it can be â€˜forkedâ€™ to different places and adopted to its local culture.

**The formula is intuitive and the message is simple and powerful.**

Just like how [Maslow summarized universal structure of basic human needs](https://www.simplypsychology.org/maslow.html#:\~:text=From%20the%20bottom%20of%20the,attend%20to%20needs%20higher%20up.), Rainbow summarized universal solutions about gathering in the forest.

Basic survival practices such as: choosing location with the right climate and source of water, setting up kitchen with chopped wood, preparing filters for river water, digging â€˜shittersâ€™ and burying feces with ashes and soil so diseases donâ€™t spread, having event calendar visible in central info station, having safe words and other codes of conductsâ€¦ All these formula are simple enough to be put into a handbook that can be carried cross boarder and language and learned quite intuitively, most of them might already be known by experienced outdoor survivors.

Just a good formula is not enough without a strong motivation to gather of course. Getting a group of unmotivated people to do things is harder than making pigs fly. For Rainbow, the motive to gather comes is simple and powerful, it is that **everybody is welcome in this gift-based society of love and peace** â€”â€” a message quite hard to say no to.

As long as people feel the need to gather, people would find ways to do so. The gathering is very much an organic and natural formation. Nothing is forced, nothing is paid for, nothing is for show, nothing is for sale. People gathered and united around a common mission in a completely authentic and compassionate way.

Just like how songs and stories spread across continents way before the birth of telegraph or internet, just like a good meme, penetrating through firewalls and cultural differences, whenever an art form or a message resonates with people deeply and fundamentally, it will flow effortlessly for as far as it can.

## The Giving Culture as a Schelling Point

Many would say Rainbow is a counter culture movement, it is everything â€˜default societyâ€™ is not. The Rainbow culture is simple enough to spread far across cultures and borders, yet profound enough to create amazing impact on individuals.

Itâ€™s quite fascinating to have hiked miles into deep forest to be offered massages and served organic vegan soup for as many times as you want, none of which cost anything.

We talk about â€˜flipping the game theoryâ€™ and â€˜incentive alignmentâ€™ a lot in the DAO space, and the folks at Rainbow did it in such a simple way ---- a demographic that supposedly has little wealth proved that achieving abundance with very little is possible. It really does make you rethink about post scarcity differently. Even thou it might not be long term sustainable and comes with its own set of problems, there are still things we can learn from.

Paradigm shift need to come from mental shift, or as the new age hippies would call it: a consciousness shift. I do believe that with any emerging communication or governance technology, **the cultural spirit would be at the center of any social movement.** There would be no social change without a mentality shift free of existing construct of exploitations and unhealthy competitions.

## Conclusion

Just like a knife can be used to cut butter or to kill people, the technology can be misused if it wasnâ€™t intentional. Just because DAOs share the same technology doesnâ€™t mean they share the same principle of operations. DAOs can be â€˜central banksâ€™, they can be outright valueless scams, or continued exploitations with cycles of pump and dump.

**We aim to create systems where people â€˜canâ€™t act badâ€™, but itâ€™s also crucial to create a culture where people â€˜donâ€™t want to act badâ€™. These two aspects, the spirit and the form, should be treated with equal importance in order to co-create something beautiful. Thatâ€™s when DAOs meet Rainbow.**

DAOs are by nature community oriented, and the community would seed the culture of the DAO. I believe [DAOs have potential to change how we coordinate and operate in many ways](https://blog.aragon.org/10-industries-being-disrupted-by-daos/), with a precondition that their shared mission is **simple and clearly defined, with authentic passion adhering to oneâ€™s intrinsic value**, and hopefully, oriented towards creating better future for all living beings. â¤ï¸

## Disclaimer â€”â€” Warnings About Rainbow âš ï¸

Without over glorifying Rainbow, itâ€™s important to mention the negative aspects of its culture.

Because everyone is welcomed, there is no guarantee that everybody at the gathering will behave in a mutually respectful way. Because it is free, there is a natural influx of people who live on the streets without homes. Because of its emphasis on personal freedom, there is always an abundance of illegal drugs.

Because of the anti-capitalistic mentality as its spirit, many people choose to be **anti-productivity** as well. Lots of people choose not to work or do anything constructive, and it became a gateway to indulgence in hedonism and anti-accomplishment mentality. The press and rumors about Rainbow are also mostly negative for all these reasons.

**Hereâ€™s my observation at the gathering:**

Going to the gathering by myself for the first time, I was unsure of what to expect and was on high alert, very soon I relaxed and felt right at home. Iâ€™ve had many fun conversations with various characters of all ages and cultural backgrounds, gypsy flow artists from Europe, qi-gong masters from China, energy healers from Israel, farmers from Iowa, intentional village organizers from Tennessee, nomads from Bosnia, musicians from Turkeyâ€¦ It was a fun and diverse group of people, I felt accepted, respected and most of the time enjoyed everyoneâ€™s company.

There was an abundance of psychedelic drugs and weed being shared at the gathering. Most of them given out for free to people who ask for them.Â Occasionally you would see people tripping hard and acting â€˜over the topâ€™, however, comparing to a regular music festival, I would say it actually has a lot less of non-sober people â€” which was a total surprise for me.

Rainbow was a lot more family oriented compare to regular music festivals. There were many kids and elderly, many people I met brought their parents. Preparing and sharing group meals and singing in music circles were the majority of the activities. I would personally bring my parents to a Rainbow Gathering but probably not Burning Man.

The only â€˜iffy thingâ€™ that I observed was when someone looked like in high adrenaline said another â€˜crazyâ€™ person was trying to attack him and he dodged away. It did remind me that this was an event that everyone is welcome and everything is allowed so we do have to be cautious.

Although it might be inevitable to have zero trash and disturbance to the environment given the scale of the gathering, I do think the organizers and volunteers did their best to protect local environment, they would spend weeks cleaning up everything after everyone leaves, â€˜putting rocks back where theyâ€™re supposed to beâ€™, said Scottie, an Urban designer from Yale whoâ€™s been organizing Rainbow for decades, â€™The location was strategically chosen to be far away from river sources to protect the local waterâ€™s ecosystem.â€™Â Everyone was also informed to only use dead trees for campfire wood and structure building.

## More Conclusions!

In the end I want to say that this post is not suggesting that if everyone becomes hippies and gather in the woods we would solve all worldâ€™s problems, nor that Rainbow is an absolute golden formula for DAOs to learn from.

The Rainbow Gathering is a formula that worked for decades, with a simple and beautiful message. It exists because it needs to exist and it will continue to exist as long as enough people make it happen, it will always be at the cross of the supply and demand curve, and the longer it goes, the more experienced it would be at decentralized autonomous gathering.

After hearing many negative comments and press about Rainbow I was glad to experience it myself and make my own distinction. Iâ€™m eternally grateful that something simple and beautiful can be experienced with no barrier of entry, and see people take care of each other with so much generosity and unconditional love. I have restored some faith in humanity, and felt encouraged to pursuit what Iâ€™m called to do ---- using technology to serve the holistic well being of humans and create abundance for all. ğŸŒˆ

title: How To Get Your ULAS DID Card | Step By Step
body:
### What is ULAS Network?

ULAS NETWORK is a multi-chain social protocol built on an open social graph and rating system. The ecosystem application on ULAS will bring data sovereignty, higher financial returns, and better experience to WEB3 citizens.

### 1. Install Keplr Wallet

[https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/keplr/dmkamcknogkgcdfhhbddcghachkejeap?hl=zh-CN](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/keplr/dmkamcknogkgcdfhhbddcghachkejeap?hl=zh-CN)

### 2. Create New Account

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/N2gykRL0g72zZJyRSEK0H.png?height=810&width=1059)

### 3. Open ULAS Official Website

[https://ulas.network/](https://ulas.network/)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_S7pfPxe0yoxbxCPAY6ox.png?height=955&width=1920)

### 4. CONNECT YOUR WALLET

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Xhv7ygXAx9zdNH5Ddkslj.png?height=955&width=1920)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/gQEv-9H1McuYwrv4o5IK0.png?height=925&width=1542)

### 5. APPLY FOR TOKEN FAUCET

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z-t2zXRj6eTKPE00grFEj.png?height=928&width=1050)

### 6. CONNECT WITH YOUR TWITTER

**Note:** After linking your tweets, you need to refresh the page if the page does not change.

### 7. Follow ULAS official Twitter

[https://twitter.com/ulas_network](https://twitter.com/ulas_network)

### 8. Custom Your DID

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z0o8Fok8x3hIvWNFwpysp.png?height=925&width=1199)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/W5Swj00vaHM19q4yLeBIs.png?height=934&width=816)

### 9. Share Your DID

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7Z3btaWFgzwWUoiU4pOnV.png?height=811&width=646)

### 10. Join ULAS Discord Channel

[https://discord.gg/cBzxqDyECp](https://discord.gg/cBzxqDyECp)

### 11. Pick Your Role & Show Your DID

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lPDkRhgwzyeCMOKnpWq-B.png?height=882&width=1524)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mrOoFn1DqODcsXiELK8OG.png?height=870&width=1523)

### 12. Waiting To Get OG Role & Mint DID Pass NFT

You still need to keep following the ULAS Network's official Twitter and Discord channels for the latest project information.

Thanks for reading!
If you have any problems with the above steps, please feel free to suggest content improvements to me.

[https://twitter.com/CosmosPandas/status/1549082449811947521](https://twitter.com/CosmosPandas/status/1549082449811947521)

### WAGMI United, a company that stands at the intersection between sports and crypto, just bought a football club.

Co-founded by** Preston Johnson **and **Eben Smith**, **WAGMI United **is [dedicated ](https://wagmiunited.com/)to bringing Web3 to the world of sports. The company just bought English Football League TwoÂ club **Crawley Town FC**. WAGMI United bought Crawley Town with an ambition to take the team to the English Premier League. Owning an NFT of WAGMI United will bring exclusive items like physical and digital merchandise, along with a say in the club's direction. Holders of the club NFTs have access to voting on :

*   Positions to sign players
*   Alternate jersey design

WAGMI United has recruited talented co-owners that are some of the most well-known names in the Web3 space including** GFunk, Gmoney, Gary Vee, Justin Taylor, Snowfro** and **Hunter Orrell**. The WAGMI United NFTs are designed in collaboration with adidas. They launched on friday the 15th and currently have a floor price of 0.25eth and 5.4k holders.

WAGMI United's landing page

Gamestop is an American video game, consumer electronics, and gaming merchandise retailer which is popularly know in the world of finance due to the â€œshort squeezeâ€ that saw the stock price rally to new ATHâ€™s in 2021. Gamestop annouced on monday the launch of their NFT marketplace in a bid to reinvent its business and cash in on consumer adoption of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. The [markeplace](https://nft.gamestop.com/) is currently in beta phase and ~~open to the public~~ available in select countries (oops). The platform allows users to connect their own digital asset wallets, including the recently launched GameStop Wallet, the company said in a press release. They will then be able to buy, sell and trade NFTs of virtual goods. Over time, the marketplace will expand to offer other features such as Web3 gaming, GameStop said.

## Celsius Files for chapter 11 bankruptcy

Crypto lending platform Celsius has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, with its lawyers starting to notify individual United States state regulators as of Wednesday. In a mail sent to its customers on Thursday the company voluntarily filed petitions for Chapter 11 reorganization and used the same firm as Voyager Digital for its bankruptcy proceedings. It is unclear what will happen with usersâ€™ funds at this stage, given there may be a [$1.2 billion hole in the firmâ€™s balance sheet](https://cointelegraph.com/news/celsius-bankruptcy-filings-show-a-company-in-deep-trouble). Earlier in the day, Celsius closed off the last of its Defi debts owed to Compound, Aave and Maker, reducing its initial debt of $820 million to just $0.013 over the course of a month. What is still unknown, however, will be the fate of depositors who still have their assets locked up on the lending platform. Neither the company nor its CEO Alex Mashinsky has made any public comments about whether depositors will receive any percentage of their funds back.

## 3AC founder breaks month long silence, plays victim card.

Su Zhu, co-founder of Singapore-based crypto venture capital firm Three Arrows Capital (3AC), returned to Twitter after nearly a month of inactivity. In another cryptic tweet, he blamed liquidators for baiting them with respect to StarkWare tokens and said that they are the ones that aren't cooperating.Â 

Because of that, he refused to appear in court last week Tuesday. *It's rumored no one knows where he actually is...*
